column4: how do I get Amarok to not show the "splash" when it changes the song?
settings configure amarok that one
in the amarok prefs
where do I get the prefs?  There isn't an obvious place on the menu
did you right click remove safely or just yank it out
I did right click, and say "unmount"
and you waited until it was unmounted?
but then it said it can't yet, and it showed that message for long (way longer than it should take to copy the files), so then I "yanked it out" as you say
but before I yanked it out, I tried to access it via terminal, and via the "explorer", but in neither could I see the USB stick... so I assumed it was unmounted already
seems some files were corrupted then; are they re-downloadable?
it is just that there is "garbage" files on the drive that I want to delete
do you have permission issues with them? are they locked for instance?
yes, it claims to be read-only, and some IO stuff too
rm: cannot remove `%│6üj5æ¼.ÆB\\': Input/output error
what about with sudo
nope sudo still doesn't delete it
can I just try fsck or similar stuff?
you can try but if it is corrupted then likelihood of success is small
any other tools that might help?
you want to remove only those files or format disk
I do not want to format the disk, because I've had a bad experience with a reformatting of a USB disk
How do I know what device is the one I want if I want to try fsck?
